instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.TPS51980: What is TPS51980? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1286 Macbook Pros,  A1297 Macbook Pros,  A1369 Macbook Airs,  A1466 Macbook Airs,  A1370 Macbook Airs,  and A1465 Macbook Airs.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
threads.message:
I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge, 

I found few threads, having the same issue they are all closed without resolution on this forum. So I will give it another try. My board is beraly water damage. turns on with battery, when connect charger percentage jumps to 100% I tried pram reset before realizing it doesnt charge. and doesn't turn on with battery unplugged.

<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> gets power
between pins
 17/18 - 4ohm
27/28 - 15 m ohm
20v PPBUS


what I think L7560 - has only 1v
if I remove coil one side has almost short 250 ohm - <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_CSN2</SIGNAL> is that normal or is it even L7560? I removed <CHIP>TPS51980</CHIP> and resistance hasn't change. 

1 photo of the element that had water damage. the other photo of L7560

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
threads.message: 20V on PPBUS doesn't worry you? 12.6V is what it should be, what is 15 m ohm? Look at diagram and tell me what the resistance should be between pins 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
threads.message:
I have no idea how I got 20v yesterday sorry. I have 1.5v on L7130, I think the problem is that transistor doesn't open <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>. from what I understand it runs by voltage difference on G and S. But <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pin 23 and 24 have the same voltage, resistance between pins is 23k. I replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> still 1.5v on both 23 and 24. any ideas?

M ohm is megaohm, I measure it again and it is 33 mohm

But <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pin 23 and 24 have the same voltage, resistance between pins is 23k. I replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> still 1.5v on both 23 and 24. any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
threads.message: Tell me what resistance should be between 27, 28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
threads.message:
so just got to it today, I run jumper between pin 27(<RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>) and <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>, resistance normal now 21 ohm. After plugin in power cord spark on <CAPACITOR>C4696</CAPACITOR>, I removed it. I still have short on L7560. after few min, green light disappear. later I figure out <CAPACITOR>C7552</CAPACITOR> in short. I replaced it, after I fixed it I tried to boot macbook with battery, another usb capacitor blown sparked( first <CAPACITOR>C4696</CAPACITOR>). all three capacitors are on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_REG</SIGNAL>, started blowing for some reason.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage increased to 4v. L7560 1.8v I tried to apply 1v to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> as a result <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> get warm, am I up to sth or it is just first thing to get warm and I have another big capacitor in short?.
I am really stuck here, Duke any ideas on how to go about this one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
threads.message: Seems like the 5V bus went high and fried stuff. What is resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yellow light doesn't charge
threads.message: Yeah this is toast, I bet the PCH got fried and everything else on this bus.
